response.feedback: Correct. Mast cells are found in the tissues and will release histamine when stimulated.
Incorrect. These cells are not phagocytic.
Incorrect. These cells are not phagocytic.
Incorrect. Mast cells are involved in the allergic and inflammatory response not killing parasites.
Incorrect. These cells release histamine but do not freely circulate in the blood.
Incorrect. These cells so not present antigen in conjunction with MHC proteins.
Incorrect. These cells do not directly kill virally infected cells.

part.hint: Among the first cell to respond to infection because they are found surrounding tissues and lymphatic vessels

response.feedback: Incorrect. Macrophages release cytokines not histamine and are not usually involved in the allergic response.
Correct. Macrophages in the tissues and monocytes in the blood are capable of phaogcytosis.
Incorrect. Macrophages are usually involved in debris clean-up and antigen recognition, not killing of bacteria.
Incorrect. Macrophages are usually involved with debris clean-up and antigen recognition not killing parasites.
Incorrect. Macrophages are usually involved with debris clean-up and antigen recognition.
Incorrect. Macrophages are usually involved with debris clean-up and antigen recognition in the general circulation.
Incorrect. Macrophages can present virally infected cells but do not kill them directly.

part.hint: These monocytes diffuse into the extracellular space and reside in almost all tissues.

response.feedback: Correct. Neutrophils are granulocytes which are very important in the bodyâ€™s response to bacterial infection. They will engulf bacterial to help eliminate them.
Incorrect. Neutrophil secretions are used to signal other innate immune response cells.
Incorrect. Neutrophils divide rapidly in response to bacterial infections and will engulf bacteria.
Incorrect. Neutrophils attack bacterial infections not parasites.
Incorrect. Neutrophils release cytokines to stimulate other cells.
Incorrect. Neutrophils are not antigen presenting cells.
Incorrect. Neutrophils attack and kill bacteria.

part.hint: These are the most abundant circulating white blood cells

response.feedback: Incorrect. Eiosinophil secretions may be used to kill internal parasites.
Incorrect. Eosinophils are not phagocytotic.
Incorrect. Eiosinophils are not phagocytotic.
Correct. Eosinophil numbers are very low but they are believed to help fight parasitic infections and may be involved in the allergic response.
Incorrect.
Incorrect. Eiosinophils are not antigen presenting cells.
Incorrect. Eiosinophils may be involved in killing parasites.

part.hint: These are also abundant in allergic reactions

response.feedback: Incorrect. These cells like mast cells release histamine and other substances that increase blood flow by releasing vasodialators and anti-coagulants which stimulates the innate immune response.
Incorrect. Basophils are not phagocytotic.
Incorrect. Basophils are not phagocytotic.
Incorrect. Basophils do not directly fight parasites.
Correct. Basophils do release histamine and can be found circulating at very low levels in the blood.
Incorrect. These cells are not antigen presenting cells.
Incorrect. Basophils do not directly kill infected cells.
Incorrect. Dendritic cells secrete granules which contain MHC cells.
Incorrect. Dendritic cells are mostly antigen presenting cells on the skin and mucus membranes and are not phagocytotic.
Incorrect. Dendritic cells are not phagocytotic.
Incorrect. Dendritic cells are mostly antigen presenting cells on the skin and mucus membrane they do not fight parasites directly.
Incorrect. These cells are mostly antigen presenting cells on the skin and mucus membranes they do not generally stimulate the inflammatory response.
Correct. Dendritic cells are named because they resemble one part of a neuron; however, they function as antigen presenting cells.
Incorrect. These cells are antigen presenting cells not killer cells.

part.hint: These are named for their many processes that resemble the processes on neurons

response.feedback: Incorrect. These cells secrete cytokines and are involved in adaptive immunity against virally infected cells.
Incorrect. Natural Killer cells are mostly involved with killing virally infected cells by inducing apoptosis of the infected cells, not phagocytosis.
Incorrect. Natural Killer cells are mostly involved with killing virally infected cells by inducing apoptosis of the infected, cells not phagocytosis.
Incorrect. These cells are mostly involved with killing virally infected cells by inducing apoptosis of the infected cells.
Incorrect. These cells are mostly involved with killing virally infected cells by inducing apoptosis of the infected cells and do not directly stimulate the inflammatory response.
Incorrect. These cells are mostly involved with killing virally infected cells and not antigen presentation.
Correct. These cells are very important when fighting viral infections.
